A viral Facebook short story on "the importance of giving" claims to share an account from Oscar-winning actress Katharine Hepburn about how her father gave away $20 to another father who couldn't afford to take his family to the circus.

The story beings with Hepburn allegedly describing how she saw a large family that made a "big impression" on her when she was standing in line to buy tickets for the circus with her father. The other family was well-behaved and excited about the circus but could not afford the tickets upon realizing the price.

"Seeing what was going on, my dad reached into his pocket, pulled out a $20 bill, and then dropped it on the ground. (We were not wealthy in any sense of the word!)" the story reads. "My father bent down, picked up the $20 bill, tapped the man on the shoulder and said, 'Excuse me, sir, this fell out of your pocket.'"
The March 13 post has hundreds of shares and was posted to the Facebook page Back to the 70s & 80s and is accompanied by a black-and-white photo of the actress.
Other users on Facebook have recently shared similar versions to group pages including Mindfulness in Daily Life and Kindness Community.
One user added a disclaimer at the top of the story that the link to Hepburn is "questionable." USA TODAY reached out to the Facebook users for comment.

Hepburn is known for writing different books including her memoir, "Me: Stories of My Life" and "The Making of the African Queen." However, she did not write the short story on circus tickets.
Snopes debunked the claim in November 2020 and discovered that the tale was originally published in "A 2nd Helping of Chicken Soup for the Soul" in 1995 under an entry titled "The Circus."

In the book, motivational speaker and life coach Dan Clark, who is a primary contributing author to the "Chicken Soup For The Soul" series, is credited for writing the story. Clark is also accurately attributed for the tale on different blog posts.

It is unclear when exactly the misattribution to Hepburn started online, however, the earliest version of the false claim appears in an April 2017 blog post.
Hepburn was born in 1907 and if the story was actually written by her, the $20 her father gave away back then would be equivalent to around $270 in current dollars, according to Snopes.

The claim that actress Katharine Hepburn authored a short story about her father giving away money so another family could buy circus tickets is FALSE, based on our research. The short story was originally written by motivational speaker Dan Clark in 1995 and is featured in the "A 2nd Helping of Chicken Soup for the Soul."
